fr.sorbonne_u.components.endpoints

Interface AbstractEndPointI

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    BCMEndPointI<CI>, BCMMultiEndPointsI, EndPointI<I>, MultiEndPointsI
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BCMEndPoint, BCMMultiEndPoints, EndPoint, MultiEndPoints, POJOEndPoint, RESTEndPoint

    public interface AbstractEndPointI
    The interface AbstractEndPointI defines the signature of methods common to all end points;
    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant
    See Also:
    for more details about end points and their usage.

    Description

    Black-box Invariant

     invariant	{@code true}	// no invariant

    Created on : 2024-07-11

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void cleanUpClientSide()
      clean up the client side of this end point, performing whatever action required to disable it definitively.
      void cleanUpServerSide()
      clean up the server side of this end point, performing whatever action required to disable it definitively.
      boolean clientSideInitialised()
      return true if the client side of this end point is initialised, false otherwise.
      void initialiseClientSide(java.lang.Object clientSideEndPointOwner)
      initialise the client side reference embedded in this end point, performing whatever action needed to make this reference readily usable.
      void initialiseServerSide(java.lang.Object serverSideEndPointOwner)
      initialise the server side of this end point, performing whatever action needed to make this reference readily usable.
      boolean serverSideInitialised()
      return true if the server side of this end point is initialised, false otherwise.
